tuv.seg: Registrars of Births, Marriages and Deaths
Cláraitheoirí Breitheanna, Póstaí agus Básanna
It is a legal requirement in Ireland that a record be kept of each birth, marriage and death that occurs in the State
Tá riachtanas dlíthiúil in Éirinn go gcoimeádtar taifead ar gach breith, pósadh agus bás a tharlaíonn sa Stát
Up to 5 December 2005, these events were recorded locally in the district where they occurred
Bhíodh na nithe seo á dtaifead go háitiúil sa cheantar inar tharla siad go dtí 5 Nollaig 2005
Since that date they can be recorded in any Registrar's District
Ón dáta sin i leith is féidir iad a thaifeadadh i gceantar aon Chláraitheora
Records of all births, marriages and deaths are held nationally in the General Register Office, the central civil repository for records relating to Births, Deaths and Marriages in Ireland

Tá taifid ar gach breith, pósadh agus bás á gcoinneáil ar bhonn náisiúnta in Oifig An Ard-Chláraitheora chomh maith. Is ionad lárnach sibhialta é an oifig sin chun taifid maidir le Breitheanna, Básanna agus Póstaí in Éirinn a stóráil
The Civil Registration Act 2004 changed some of the rules about registering a birth or death
Athraíonn An tAcht um Chlárú Sibhialta 2004 cuid de na rialacha maidir le breith agus bás a chlárú
These changes took effect from 5 December 2005. They took effect for marriages from 5 November 2007
Tháinig na hathruithe seo i bhfeidhm an 5 Nollaig 2005 agus le daoine pósta i bhfeidhm an 5 Samhain 2007
When a birth, marriage or death is recorded in Ireland, a certificate is issued to the individual(s) concerned (i.e
Nuair a dhéantar breith, pósadh nó bás a thaifeadadh in Éirinn eisítear teastas don duine, nó do na daoine, lena mbaineann (.i
the parents in the event of a birth, the couple in the event of a marriage and the next-of-kin in the event of a death)
na tuismitheoirí i gcás breithe, an lánúin i gcás pósta, agus na neasghaolta i gcás báis)
This record of the birth, death or marriage is a very important legal document and should be kept in a safe place
Is cáipéis dlí thábhachtach é an taifead seo ar bhreith, bás nó pósadh agus ba chóir é a choinneáil in áit shábháilte
A birth certificate is required if you wish to enrol your child in school, apply for an Irish passport, etc
Beidh teastas breithe ag teastáil más mian leat do leanbh a chlárú i scoil, má tá tú ag cur isteach ar phas Éireannach, srl
A death certificate is required if you are dealing with the deceased person's estate, etc
Bíonn teastas báis ag teastáil má bhíonn tú ag plé le heastáit duine mhairbh
If you need to apply for a birth, marriage or death certificate, or a copy of these certificates you can apply online or get in touch with the appropriate Registrar in any Registrar's District

Más gá duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar theastas breithe, pósta nó báis, nó ar chóip de cheann de na teastais sin, ní mór duit dul i dteagmháil leis an gCláraitheoir sa cheantar ina tharla an tarlúint (nó i gCeantar aon Chláraitheora, ó 5 Nollaig 2005 i leith)
You can also apply to the General Register Office in Roscommon
Ina ionad sin, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh chuig Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora i Ros Comáin
Adopted children's Birth Certificates are only available from the General Register Office
Ní féidir leat teastas breithe a fháil do leanbh uchtaithe ach ó Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora
You will be required to pay a fee if you require a copy of these certificates
Beidh ort táille íseal a íoc má tá cóip de cheann de na teastais sin uait
Records of marriages (other than Roman Catholic) held in the General Register Office (Roscommon) date back to 1 April 1845
Téann taifid phóstaí (seachas póstaí Caitliceacha Rómhánacha) a choimeádtar in Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora i Ros Comáin siar chomh fada le 1 Aibreán 1845
Records of births, deaths and Roman Catholic marriages date back to 1 January 1864
Téann taifid bhreithe, bhásanna agus na bpóstaí Caitliceacha Rómhánacha siar go 1 Eanáir 1864
The General Register Office does not engage in family history research
Ní dhéanann Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora taighde ar stair chlainne
Registration of births, marriages and deaths
Clárú breitheanna, póstaí agus básanna
Further information on registering the birth of your baby is available here
Is féidir breis eolais maidir le breith do linbh a chlárú a fháil anseo
Further information on marriage registration in Ireland (and the recognition of marriages abroad in Ireland) is available here
Is féidir breis eolais maidir le clárú pósta in Éirinn (agus aitheantas in Éirinn do phóstaí thar lear) le fáil anseo
Information on how to register a death in Ireland is available here
Tá eolas faoi conas bás a chlárú in Éirinn le fáil anseo
The Registrar you need to contact used to be determined by where the event took place - not where you lived at the time, or where you live now
Bhíodh ort dul i dteagmháil leis an gCláraitheoir san áit inar tharla an tarlúint - agus ní san áit a raibh tú i do chónaí ann ag an am, nó an áit a bhfuil cónaí ort ann anois
Since 5 December 2005 you may contact any Registrar
(Ón 5 Nollaig 2005 ar aghaidh féadfaidh tú dul i dteagmháil le Cláraitheoir ar bith.) Is féidir teastas breithe a fháil go díreach ón gCláraitheoir a luaithe is a chláraítear an bhreith
Birth Certificates may be obtained, once the registration of the birth has taken place, from the Registrar directly or from any Registrar's Office
Is féidir teastais a fháil ó Oifig an Phríomh-Chláraitheora, i gceann tuairim is trí mhí ó am an chláraithe. Tá sonraí ar fáil thíos
If you have any difficulty in determining the identity of a Registrar you should contact the local Superintendent Registrar's Office as detailed below for the required information
Má tá deacracht agat a fháil amach cé hé an Cláraitheoir ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil le hOifig an Phríomh-Chláraitheora áitiúil chun an fhaisnéis chuí a fháil. Tá sonraí ar fáil thíos
There is no fee charged for the registration of a birth, marriage or death, or for re-registration of a birth to include a parent's details
Ní ghearrtar aon táillí ar chlárú breithe, pósta ná báis, nó d’athchlárú breithe chun sonraí tuismitheora a chur san áireamh
Fees are charged for copies of certificates
Gearrtar táillí ar chóipeanna teastais
A certificate is issued for social welfare purposes at a reduced cost
Eisítear teatas do chuspóirí leasa shóisialaigh ar chostas laghdaithe
Evidence it is for social welfare purposes is required, such as a note from the Department of Social Protection
Teastaíonn fianaise gur mar gheall ar chuspóirí leasa shóisialaigh atá se ag teastáil, cosúil le nóta ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaigh
The fees charged for a certificate are:
Is iad na táillí a ghearrtar ar theastas ná:
• €1 for a copy for social welfare purposes, including registration for a Public Services Card (letter from Department of Social Protection required)
• €1 do chóip chun críocha leasa shóisialaigh, lena n-áirítear clárú do Chárta Seirbhísí Poiblí (litir ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí ag teastáil)
• €4 for an uncertified copy of an entry in the Register
• €4 do chóip neamhdheimhnithe d’iontráil isteach sa Clár
• €10 to have a certificate authenticated (only available from the General Register Office)
• €10 go bhfuil deimhniú fíordheimhnithe (ar fáil ón Oifig Chlár Ghinearálta amháin)
• €10 for a certified copy of an entry in the Adopted Children Register (can be used for legal and administrative purposes)
• €10 ar chóip dheimhnithe de thaifead sa Chlár d'Uchtleanaí (is féidir a úsáid chun críocha dlí agus riaracháin)
Copies of birth, marriage and death certificates in Ireland may be obtained from any Registrar (see below) and can also be obtained from the General Register Office
Is féidir cóipeanna de theastais bhreithe, phósta agus bháis a fháil ó aon Chláraitheoir (féach thíos) agus is fédir iad a fháil freisin ón Oifig Chlár Ghinearálta
As these are public records anybody can apply
Mar gheall gur taifid phoiblí atá iontu seo, is féidir le haon duine cur isteach orthu
You can download the appropriate application form here
Is féidir leat an fhoirm iarratais chuí a íoslódáil anseo
You can also apply online for copies of certificates, including domestic adoptions and stillbirths that have been registered
Is féidir leat cur isteach ar-líne ar chóipeanna de theastais, ina n-áirítear aon uchtaithe intíre agus marbh-bhreitheanna atá cláraithe
Contact information for Registrars of Births, Marriages and Deaths is available here, including addresses, opening hours, etc
Tá eolas teagmhála le haghaidh Cláraitheoirí Breitheanna, Póstaí agus Básanna ar fáil anseo, lena n-áirítear seoltaí, uaireanta oscailte, srl
